results.title: The Animal movie
results.creator_credit: Ron Tunis, Grant Munro, Sidney Goldsmith and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated cartoon to help children explore why and how animals move as they do. A little boy discovers that he cannot compete with animals - monkey, snake, horse etc - by imitating the way they move. He only outdistances them when he climbs into a vehicle that can travel in any environment - proving that, while other animals are trapped by their environment, man, the inventor, isn’t. An award winning film.

results.title: The Agony of Jimmy Quinlan
results.creator_credit: Andy Thomson, Janice H Brown, Robert Duncan, Peter Katadotis and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Jimmy Quinlan is a derelict, one of some five thousand other men and women who have abandoned their jobs and families to live in the streets and alleys in Montreal. This film, a powerful portrayal of life on skid row, tells of his “agonies” - his attempt to get off the bottle. It’s something he’s tried before, and will probably have to try again. Award: New York

results.title: The Ageing of the lakes
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Explains the process of the natural ageing and eventual death of lakes, called eutrophication. Also links man’s environmental interference with the changes in the lakes and investigates current efforts to retard eutrophication and preserve and restore lakes in America. Discusses pollution and methods for its control.

results.title: The Angel and the devil = Tian shi yu mo gui
results.creator_credit: Xiao Rong, Ling Qiwei and Pearl River Film Studio
results.brief_description:
Zheng Tian and his gangster friends live life on stealing and robbery. Zheng Tian believes that human nature is half good and half evil, and therefore, his life has two sides. On the one hand, he likes to help people, on the other hand, he commit crimes. Once at a metro station, Zheng Tian comes across a girl who has similar experience as Zheng Tian but has now cut off from her past. The two fall in love and decide to have a new life. But Zhen Tian is tempted by his friends to commit crimes again and is arrested. His girlfriend becomes a member of the Buddhism Association. Zheng Tian understands how his girlfriend has suffered and writes a film script based on his true stories in prison. Towards the end of Zheng Tian’s jail term, he is chosen to play himself in the film and Zheng Tian wants to start a new life with his girlfriend. The film stars Chen Baoguo, who is a leading actor in China and has appeared in many films and TV series.

The film is adapted from well-known Chinese writer, Wang Shuo’s popular novel Half Flame, Half Seawater. Wang Shuo’s work has been translated into many languages and most of his novels have been adapted into films, for example In the Heat of the Sun (dir. Jiang Wen, 1994), Little Red Flowers (dir. Zhang Yuan, 2006) and so on. This film shows that before the 1990s, a lot of PRC films have educational purposes. (3 stars - Yuxing Zhou; December 16, 2010)

results.title: The American nightmare
results.creator_credit: Adam Simon, Jonathan Sehring, Colin MacCabe, Paula Jalfon and Independent Film Channel
results.brief_description: In this documentary, focusing on horror films from the 60s and 70s, director and screenwriter Adam Simon convincingly argues that the artists crucial to those works (in particular the directors) were reflecting the greater problems facing American society at that time - the Vietnam War, corruption of government, the conflicts of the Civil Rights movement and the divisiveness between generations. Interviews with key directors and scholars is interspersed with extensive clips from films such as “The Last house on the left” and “Night of the living dead” as well as news footage from Vietnam, political assassinations and other terrifying world events. Interviewees include: George A. Romero, John Carpenter, Tom Savini, David Cronenberg, Wes Craven, Tobe Hooper, John Landis. Contains graphic images and please note, some scenes may disturb.

results.title: The American Film Institute salute to Jimmy Stewart
results.creator_credit: Marty Pasetta, George Stevens Jr and American Film Institute
results.brief_description: This series from the American Film Institute (AFI) salutes some of the biggest stars that shaped the face of Hollywood. Jimmy (James) Stewart whose career spanned over 45 years having acted in over 80 films is honoured here with an AFI Lifetime Achievement Award. Jimmy became an American icon and came to symbolise the greatest of American family values. Especially noted in this program is Jimmy’s unique ability of bringing his characters to life. As an audience we lose the sense of the actor acting and are transported by the real feeling given to his characters. Excerpts from some of his best known films are shown ‘It’s a wonderful life’, ‘Rear window’, ‘Mr Smith goes to Washington’, ‘Harvey’ and much more. Princess Grace of Monaco (Grace Kelly) gives a rare Hollywood appearance amongst others of his colleagues including: Walter Matthau, Jack Lemmon, Charlton Heston, Spencer Tracy, Henry Fonda, Gene Kelly, Dustin Hoffman and Alfred Hitchcock.

results.title: The Amazing adventure
results.brief_description: Cary Grant returned to England to make “The Amazing adventure” one of the few films he made outside of Hollywood in the 1930s. Grant plays Ernest Bliss, a man who is independently wealthy due to an inheritance but whose life lacks meaning. Suffering a type of depression exclusive to the idle rich, Bliss consults a doctor who wages Bliss 50,000 pounds that he can’t last a year earning his own keep. Bliss determines to meet the challenge and sets off in search of employment. Depression era London proves to be a tough life for Bliss, whose experiences over the year shape him significantly. The bet is set awry when Bliss meets Frances - a woman being forced to marry for money despite her reciprocated love for Bliss. The film adheres to the Depression formula of a man who renounces his wealth in order to experience life first hand and learn lessons of good-hearted common people. This version is the 62-minute American release. Also starring Mary Brian, Peter Gawthorne, and Henry Kendall. Based on the book by English novelist E. Phillips Oppenheimer.

results.title: The Allan Border tribute match
results.brief_description: In front of a capacity crowd and television audiences Australia-wide, Allan Border’s XI crept home to a last ball win over the International XI. A selection of cricketing legends and sporting personalities were brought together to pay tribute to the man who was one of Australian cricket’s greatest captains and all-round star. Due to the nature of the original footage from the National Nine Network telecast of 19 December 1993, some minor technical faults may appear.
